website_summaries.verdict: Buyers needing a no-mess chalk option will admire this bottled liquid chalk product.
pros: Available for purchase in many different sizes
Liquid turns into chalk once in hands for a practically mess-free chalk experience
cons: Tends to wear off faster than regular powder chalk
A little too fine for some

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for when there's no real chalk
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great. I use this when my deadlifts get up over 225 or so, and it's every bit as good as gym chalk. I had an assumption that it would create dust like regular chalk, but it does. It leaves residue on the bar and weights, and bits of dust flake off. Still, it's not as obnoxious as real chalk. Put a small dab on the problem areas of your hand, rub your hands together, and wave them around for 7-10 seconds. Boom. Hit that bar.
customer_reviews.author: Ed H.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising. Tearing up hands faster than any chalks I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: this product can not be sold to people working out at gyms. I bought this liquid chalk coz using powder chalks is frowned upon at my gym. The first pic was taken two days ago when I was doing 395 deadlift for three rep sets. I thought I’d give it a second try today. So the second pic was taken today before I applied the chalk. The third pic was taken after I was doing 305 deadlift at 7 reps (10 mins ago). I’ve been doing deadlifts for years. This never happened to me twice in a single week! Where are all these 5 star reviews coming from? Going back to traditional chalks today!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wong

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Product
customer_reviews.text: A fellow lifter at the gym had this particular product on our heavy deadlift day and shared it with me. I was immediately a convert, and went home and ordered it for myself. I'm so happy with the chalk and the company. I love that it is a small group. Supporting small business is really important to me, so the purchase was good for me on multiple levels - upping my game at the gym, and buying wise. Will definitely be proselytizing for Fire Team Fit from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Dingo St. John

customer_reviews.title: Dries quickly, usually lasts an entire workout
customer_reviews.text: Stuff works great. I apply a dime size amount to my palm and it covers everything nicely. Dries in about 30 seconds. I'm a weightlifter, and one application is about all I need to last through a 2 hour workout. If I'm doing Crossfit, I usually have to reapply once depending on what I'm doing and how sweaty I'm getting. Great product for gyms that don't allow chalk
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Feels slightly thin, but seems to be pretty effective
customer_reviews.text: The consistency felt thin and slightly watery, which I think might be by design. But it made it slightly difficult to get a thicker coat of the chalk on my hands when it dried. Consequently it does dry really fast, but not before you can coat everything on your hands that you likely want to--which is a plus. The quality feels nice, but I think I personally would seek out a thicker version for a repeat purchase. To whatever degree it matters, I was using this for indoor rock climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Frank D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has made a huge difference in my heavier lifts. My gym doesn't technically allow chalk, so this has been a great alternative. I do have to sometimes re-apply during my workout, but I tend to favor a "less is more" application style. I also like that it's easy to remove the remnant chalk bits with a little hand sanitizer and a towel.
customer_reviews.author: A. H. Drazin

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: Tried liquid chalk for the first time, and it is a lot cleaner and easier to use than powder chalk. The only issue I have with this liquid chalk is that it dries your hands TOO much and it will cause your skin to break and peel. I advise to use a little less than a dime size amount for the entirety of your gym session. EDIT: After talking to representative from the Fire Team Fit, they offered to give me a full refund or even to try the product again. The customer service is exceptional and I highly recommend you give this product a try.
customer_reviews.author: D. H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heavy pull day
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. Just rub on like lotion and within 5 seconds your hands have a perfect layer of chalk on them. Easy to get exactly where you want and to reapply. So much better than solid chalk. I use for weightlifting - weighted pull-ups, deadlifts, heavy rows, etc. can’t say how it works for climbing but I imagine it would be excellent with the exception that it’s impossible to reapply while you’re on the wall. Still, lasts longer than solid chalk, so I would think it would be pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Raycroft

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for deadlifts and bench press for the last few months. It dries fast; it doesn't leave much mess (unlike powdered chalk) and is pretty good in terms of preventing slippage. The only drawback I see is that it is relatively small (the bottle is the size of my palm?) so there is a chance that you'll run through it relatively quickly. It is also more expensive than your average chalk block; however, the quality seems better than your average chalk block. I do recommend getting it because of the cleanliness, speed and quality factor; however, I suggest you get it in addition to regular chalk due to the small quantity.
customer_reviews.author: R.Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Less messy, but sweats off too easily
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try this since it was less messy than block chalk, and like a lot of us I've been working out from home. I found that it does a pretty decent job for shorter workouts (30 minutes are under), but beyond that I found it would start to rub off pretty seriously as my hands got sweatier. You can't really re-apply this to sweaty hands and even when towling off, I'd find it was hard to get a re-apply to dry correctly mid-workout. I suppose your mileage may vary based on how much you sweat, but it's back to block chalk for me.
customer_reviews.author: David Scroggins

customer_reviews.title: Magic monkey grip!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product!! I used it for a super rainy & muddy OCR-the grip was UNREAL on monkey bars and rings! My hands went from wet and muddy in seconds to dry and grippy. A little goes a long way with this, I used about 1/4 teaspoon each time-I am sure I would not have needed to reapply if it was not so rainy. I purchased the 50 ml tube-small enough to keep in a runners belt. Really outstanding product!
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to chalk my hands for CrossFit. I like that there isn't any dust and it dries fast. Obviously if you touch stuff while it is on your hands there is the chalky residue, but it is liquid chalk. I just dab on a little and rub it around where I need it and then blow on it a little and ready to go. Easy to use even while in the middle of a workout. The picture for the advertisement shows it pretty excessive on your hands... so I don't use quite that much. Anyway good product and I have ordered twice.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson W.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the old fashioned powder stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to use for our indoor gym (In our home). He’s retired military and stays very active lifting. When COVID hit he wanted something that would aid his grip without making a mess in the house and all over his gym equipment. He was very satisfied with this product, which is why I’m writing the review. He had never used a liquid chalk before and was amazed at the grip and the durability - “much better than the powder” per his review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifters listen up.
customer_reviews.text: I only use this for when I dead-lift. I don't use gloves or wraps as they make my hands and wrist uncomfortable so I use chalk instead. The issue with the chalk is the powder gets everywhere and makes a mess. This liquid chalk is perfect! It is easy to transport, doesn't make a mess in my gym bag, and works like its intended too. Just apply a dime size amount and rub your hands together then air dry them and boom! Chalky hands! Works the same as normal chalk and still provides the grip I'm looking for when dead-lifting. You gotta try this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: John Lazar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs - weight lifting
customer_reviews.text: This chalk is great for lifting weights and similar things like pull-ups. In a two hour work out, I only need to apply it about 3 times. It takes just a small amount to be effective. Working out every other day, a 50ml bottle would last me about a month. Maybe two months.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Digby Sellers

customer_reviews.title: new gym no chalk
customer_reviews.text: i started going to a new gym and i use chalk when i have a heavy top set. this new gym is very humid, and they don't have chalk. i know that different gyms have rules about chalking so i decided to give liquid chalk a try. it works pretty well. i went through the bottle relatively fast. the only drawback is, like i mentioned the gym is very humid, so I'm sweating a lot and it kind of ruins the application so i'd have to reapply frequently.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Life and palmsaver!
customer_reviews.text: My gym no longer has chalk available for use due to COVID guidelines but we're allowed to use our own liquid chalk. I ordered this and got it the next day and it's constantly getting used for pull-ups and barbell or kettlebell movements. It dries quickly and lasts a long time. I actually have a hard time washing it off when I'm done it sticks so well. My one little tube has already lasted a few months with no end in sight so a little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and handy!
customer_reviews.text: Great chalk for the gym if you like doing deadlifts and pull-ups. Very reliable and the weight does not slip off. Easy to wash off once you’re done working out. Second time I’ve ordered and I’m always satisfied. The keychain sized bottle lasts me a few months before it runs out. Two thumbs up. I was disappointed when I opened the package this time around and found the bottle cap broken off but understandable since it was placed in a box with a 10 pound chrome lifting bar from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Less mess
customer_reviews.text: I use in my home gym and didn't want to track down a dish and block of chalk when I could simply buy this bottle and keep it all in one tidy package. That said after seeing barbell gyms with traditional chalk and comparing to this solution, you quickly realize its next to no mess. Thats super important to me since my garage is right on the street and shared with a car. Can't have that lookin sloppy!
customer_reviews.author: CarlTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Seriously? How did I not have this before?
customer_reviews.text: Queen of sweaty hands, arms and palms! Even with weight lifting grips, my hands struggled to hold on since they were wayyy to slippery. Thank gawddd I tried this, I seriously don’t know how I went all these years in weightlifting without this!!!! LIFT SAVER!! Applies easily, doesn’t get all over the place, and dries super fast! A forever buyer!
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Woman

customer_reviews.title: Better off buying real chalk
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product at first but it let me down. It's compact and identical to real chalk without the mess but when I realized how overpriced it is compared to similar products, I decided against a second purchase- for example, I got maybe, 10ish uses out of it before it was empty. For its price, buying solid chalk or even a bag would last you 10x as long. Also, the liquid would constantly dry out at the spout making it impossible to normally apply it on my hands making each gym session a 5 minute endeavor to remove dried gunk off the spout (wasted chalk).
customer_reviews.author: Gianluca Arenella

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a cleaner chalk option
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the feel of regular chalk but if you're trying to keep things clean this is a great option and it does work almost as well. This stuff sticks to your hands but some does fall off as chalk dust just not very much
customer_reviews.author: CRazz

customer_reviews.title: Great to hang up to keep conveniently by workout station
customer_reviews.text: Since we’ve been working out at home we needed some chalk and thought we would try the liquid version. It goes on well but it doesn’t protect as much as the original block of chalk does A great feature Is that it has a hole that could be hung up for convenience - making it easy to fine when you need it. It leaves a film of residue on your hands you really have to wash off when you are finished.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be a slob- get this instead!
customer_reviews.text: Tired of going to the gym and getting chalk all over the floor, your clothes, the equipment, etc.? This stuff is AWESOME! I purchased it for my husband to used when he doesn’t want to wear his gloves. You just rub it on the inside of your hands and it dries within seconds, revealing a layer of chalk. It isn’t messy and he says it works great and gives him a lot of grip!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Little thick but works
customer_reviews.text: The liquid chalk idea is great but I find this chalk to be reaLly thick and has even dried up in the tube at the cap. Makes it impossible to use without having to do some surgery on the bottle first. when it comes out its great, stays on. I usually find I get too much but end up rubbing the excess from my hands on my bar. I am still left with a layer on my skin.
customer_reviews.author: DDD13

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this stuff!!! A little squirt on your hands, rub them together, and you are set! This stuff dries super quick, and a little goes a long way. Gives me excellent grip without ANY of the mess of regular chalk! I work out at home & don't want chalk all over the floor. I have no problem with my hands slipping on my deadlifts now!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri M.

customer_reviews.title: Works! Keeps your hands dry
customer_reviews.text: Keeps your hands dry while the rest of your body is drenched in sweat! I apply as much shown in the photo and dries within a minute. The dust when fresh will get on everything so I wait after two sets to touch my things other than the equipment I’m using. I apply once per workout. Depending how much I need my grip. I may however use less to reduce the dust settling, save product due to size (I appreciate the carabiner btw it saves me a mess!) and for the sake of courtesy among others.
customer_reviews.author: Arabella⚡️

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - Not as good as real chalk
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months and I find it helpful but not as good as real chalk. I think your best bet is to grab the bar immediately after applying this while it's still "sticky" (especially for deadlifts). If your gym won't allow chalk I think this is a great option but if you have the option of applying chalk then your better off doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Ray N

customer_reviews.title: No Mess Chalk
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy liquid chalk after I was told I could use it in the gym I go too. This product is a lifesaver. It doesn't make much of a mess at all, dries literally in like 10 seconds (not a joke) and for me it lasts for the heavy lifts on leg days (30 minutes of deadlifting). I only need it to last for this lift so it works amazing for me. Can be easily reapplied though if necessary (also amazing). Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: gmbells

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular chalk!
customer_reviews.text: This product is PHENOMENAL. I do not like using chalk because it gets all over the place and the gym I train at doesn’t care for it either. One small application of this liquid chalk lasted my entire workout. No mess! Easy clean up. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly at Farmhouse Kitchen Love

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for the size you get.
customer_reviews.text: $10.99 for this bottle is ridiculous. It works well but even using it sparingly it won’t last very long. Also the seal on the bottle is terrible. You can’t peel it off, forcing you to poke a hole in it to try to get it off, which causes pieces of it to get stuck in the bottle sometimes creating a mess. Overall the product works well, a little goes a long way. I will definitely be looking for a cheaper alternative though.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product from a great company.
customer_reviews.text: Got this liquid chalk to keep my hands dry while doing deadlifts. Works great. Its a great alternative to regular chalk and doesn't make a mess. I would recommend if you need some chalk to keep your hands dry but work out at a gym that doesn't allow chalk or if you don't want to deal with regular chalk. I will definitely be keeping this stuff in my gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: WHY DID I NOT DO THIS BEFORE?!?!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AWESOME!! I've tried gloves, sports wrap, etc for deadlifting and nothing has worked like this!! I'm a smaller guy with smaller hands, and without the assist of deadlifting gloves (with hooks) I'm not able to hold 405lbs for very long. With the aid of this liquid chalk, I can easily do multiple reps of 495lbs without slipping!!
customer_reviews.author: BUFDADDY

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting grip!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase, the chalk rubs on easily and lasts almost my whole hour workout. The gym I go to does not allow normal chalk like i am used to using but said liquid was ok, so I gave it a shot. It met expectations and then some. I was pleased to not have to continuously be re applying like normal chalk and there was no odor after if finished drying. And like any chalk it has the tendency to disappear if it gets wet from water bottle or other outside water source. I will be buying the large bottle once my little one is out!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Gates

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say that I have been using this product for a month every day in the gym with 2 other people using it as well. For an hour gym sesh i probably use 2-3 squirts and still have not finished the key chain bottle yet. This really helps your grip and confidence when lifting weights. The quality, consistency, and price of this product is unmatched and if you buy the juggernaut bottle it will last for a VERY VERY VERY LONG TIME
customer_reviews.author: Brian Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Sweat resistant liquid chalk
customer_reviews.text: I tried this chalk for the first time last week doing deadlifts and I have to say it really made a difference for me. The bottle itself just clips to my bag, so it stays out of the way but is easy to grab whenever I need it. It's super easy to use, just a small amount gave me pretty even coverage and lasted through six sets before I re-applied any. Also I sweat a lot, and while it did trickle down my palms, just rubbing my hands together brought full coverage back. You have to really wash thoroughly to get this stuff off, so for marathon sets or particularly intense work outs this chalk is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Liquid Chalk helps grip friction, Easy to apply, Easy to wash off.
customer_reviews.text: It provides extra friction and doesn't leave a mess. Great for deadlifts and overhead press. Doesn't clump up, spreads evenly, dries in like 10 seconds, doesn't have an odor. Good enough for an average guy like me since I'm not aiming to be a competitive weightlifter. The bottle volume is small for the price, and I wish I got 2x more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Second time ordering.
customer_reviews.text: I use this stuff daily in my workouts, and just had to order a second tube of it. It's helped improve my grip, and my son is now using it too, as his hands sweat a ton and he finds the weights slipping. I love that it washed off quickly and completely, and doesn't leave any residue. I'll definitely keep ordering it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Gergets

customer_reviews.title: Great chalk - less mess - longer lasting
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit more expensive than the traditional block chalk but it’s much more portable and a significantly less messy application/process. I think it actually performs a bit better than block chalk - I only have to apply about a dime size amount for my entire workout. It seems to be able to reactivate to spend areas on the hands just by rubbing your hands togther. Comes off in a sinch with water/soap.
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: Sweaty palm..look no further!
customer_reviews.text: I Crossfit and powerlift but I have sweaty palms which makes regular chalk useless so I needed an alternative. I’ve heard about liquid chalk and decided to purchase this item, I received it yesterday and used it this morning for my powerlifting session. AMAZING!!!! Lifted for over an hour and the chalk was still on my hands despite my sweatiness (lol). This is a product I will definitely be purchasing always! Another plus is this company is veteran owned 👍🏽👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: Salina Lujan

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: My gym doesn't allow chalk, and I gave up weight lifting gloves a year ago because the small amount of padding was reducing my grip. The liquid chalk has been a game changer. There was a small amount of transfer from my hands to the barbell and weight plates during the first few minutes of use, but it only took seconds to wipe away. Even on the 6th set of heavy deadlifts (300 lbs), the bar never left the center of my palm and never touched my callouses! I'm looking forward to max deadlift day because I think I'll hit a PR with my new grip.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Hoyle

customer_reviews.title: Powerlifter approved!
customer_reviews.text: I work out at a couple different gyms for convenience and unfortunately the one closest to my house does not allow chalk to be used. I decided to try this out as an alternative for my heavy deadlift days and it does the trick! It will transfer some residue onto the barbell and weight plates, but it could easily be wiped off if needed. It’s not near the mess that traditional chalk leaves. I get to keep my grip on heavy deadlifts and my gym doesn’t get mad at me for leaving a mess, it’s a win, win!
customer_reviews.author: errrca

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My health club doesn't have chalk available, and my sweaty palms were ruining my lifts. And then I met Liquid Fit Chalk. Problem solved. This stuff goes a LONG way - had my first bottle for 3 months and just re-upped. No mess, cleans easily, great grip. And love the fact that these guys are ex-Marines. Oorah!
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, too expensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a keychain size bottle. My fault as I should have read up on the amount being sold. 50ml is the ad but many don't realize how little that amount actually is. It's just over 1.5oz. For reference, a liquor shot glass is 2oz. I mean come on, it's a mixture of Chalk and alcohol!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted this to work for me but sadly it did not. I powerlift and wanted another option that was less messy than loose chalk- it is just as messy. The application is fine but as soon as it dries it flakes off? Then when you try to reapply it’s a mess... as for the boast that it last all workout lol... It didn’t make it passed one set.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wiersum

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for deadlift. I kept losing grip when getting near my max. I workout in a community center so I can't bring in traditional chalk. This is a great alternative. It's not completely clean, will leave residue on the bar, but it has worked great so far. Dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome! Much better and applies thicker than other liquid ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome! Much better and applies thicker than other liquid chalk brands I’ve used in the past. It stays on and delivers exactly the experience I wanted without having to get actual chalk all over my gym. Don’t buy anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Fast drying, easy to come off
customer_reviews.text: My university gym doesn't allow chalk, so I got this liquid chalk as a substitute. Great product. Dries extremely fast, lasts long enough, and comes off easily. Does not stain clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Grip all the things!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time for a heavy deadlift day in the garage...that alsi happened to be a day it was 97 degrees. Worked like a charm! I was a sweaty mess, and the chalk helped out big time with my grip. A friend asked if it was the "anti-lube"...it is;)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Amparan

customer_reviews.title: Best liquid chalk
customer_reviews.text: This is most convenient chalk I've ever used in terms of portability and clean up. It helped make my hands less sweaty, but I didn't feel like it gave me that "chalk grip" Convenience: 5/5 Clean up/lack of mess: 5/5 Grip: 3/5
customer_reviews.author: Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Sucking a Golf Ball through a Garden Hose
customer_reviews.text: As the title expresses, upon releasing the Kraken, or in this case taking off the seal, this product turns into a paste and is impossible to get out without taking the cap off. Unless you carry around a toothpick or some foreign object similar, then that's about the only way to get this substance out. But don't squeeze too hard, or you might find this white, pasty substance spraying your fellow gym members like a teenage boy with a stack of his Mom's lingerie catalogs. Other than that, it works. I was able to grab the bar like I was choking my chicken without one slip.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Say Hello To My Little Friend!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to look like Scarface at the gym when I did deadlifts... white powder everywhere!!! Liquid chalk is such a cleaner solution, plus I get a waaaay better grip on the bar. 415 pounds here I come and I don’t have shady guys trying to sell me stuff in the parking lot anymore. A+ product. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Achap

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I saw a dude using this in the gym two days ago, borrowed some (as my grip was failing and old straps weren't helping much), and was really impressed. Then pulled up my phone and ordered a bottle for myself right away. It was delivered yesterday, and tonight I went to lift weights trying my own liquid chalk.:) This is a treasure I've been missing, especially since some gyms ban regular chalk. Helps a lot with the grip!
customer_reviews.author: Nikolay

customer_reviews.title: Very Good! Recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I have really sweaty hands when I do CrossFit and weightlifting so I decided to give this a try and It's pretty good. Maybe too good because doing too muscle ups and pull ups rip the skin off my hands but the other movements like snatch, C&J's, deadlift etc I have no problem. It's just me might work very well on you.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hor

customer_reviews.title: Dries up
customer_reviews.text: Dries up every time I use it and I do close the top correctly. I have to scrape a knife in there to get more out while it all hardens up which is really frustrating every time I work out. Will consider changing my review if I am compensated for this loss
customer_reviews.author: Craig Levinson

customer_reviews.title: Works but Dried out 3 months later
customer_reviews.text: Bought it about 3 months ago when I was doing a lot of deadlifting and it was working great. Switched up the routine and didn't use it for a while and now it has dried out and is a pasty consistency that won't squeeze out of the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Vee79

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR BOULDERING
customer_reviews.text: It was pricey for how much you got, but I could easily carry it around so that's why I got it. It did not work well, the chalk was gone after one climb. I was so frustrated I bought new chalk from the gym and it was cheaper and had more product than this. I just feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Katie M.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: I do grip exercises that require chalk. I do these at home and don't want chalk flying all around all over my furniture. This product is very "neat" to use. I can use just a little on my fingertips and there's no excess. And it's easy to wash off my hands with soap and water. I'm totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: K-Man

customer_reviews.title: Great chalk for bouldering and climbing.
customer_reviews.text: This chalk does a great job of keeping your hands dry and loose chalk doesn’t fly all over the place. This should be a standard for climbing gyms in keeping their air free of chalk dust. Best for bouldering and short climbs. You wouldn’t usually apply it mid-climb because it requires two hands to apply. However, I find that it keeps my hands drier about 2x as long as loose chalk.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Not for sweaty hands
customer_reviews.text: Bought since COVID means no gym chalk. Goes on well initially, totally costs the hands, dries quickly. However, it Doesn’t last very long and once my hands got sweaty, it didn’t stick/apply well. I’ll buy regular chalk now
customer_reviews.author: Katie Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy a different brand, but I wanted to try something new and I liked the clip on the bottle. I'll say the experience has been okay. Seems to take more to get the same result, and it wears off very quickly compared to the other brand I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: any high intensity workout where you are sweating and the chalk is basically useless and sweats right off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try as an alternative for regular chalk for use during weightlifting and crossfit sessions. It goes on quickly and dries fairly quickly. Unfortunately, any high intensity workout where you are sweating and the chalk is basically useless and sweats right off. At least with regular chalk you can rechalk quickly and keep going wirthout missing a beat. So if you are a low rep heavy powerlifter with max time between sets this might still work for you; other than that I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: buzz

customer_reviews.title: Great for Lifting
customer_reviews.text: Great product for keeping hands dry and for better contact with the bar; doesn't really help with grip as best as lifting straps to me, but overall a great addition to the gym bag and much less messier than chalk!
customer_reviews.author: DLC

customer_reviews.title: Comes off quickly during workouts.
customer_reviews.text: The liquid chalk applies very easily, but comes off in a flash the minute my hands get even slightly sweaty. I wanted to love it and hoped it would last longer than powdered chalk for Cross Fit workouts, but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: ComfortablyKir

customer_reviews.title: Dude, what is that smell
customer_reviews.text: That smell is this liquid chalk. It stink, horribly. Maybe mine was past its sell by date? We used it probably 3 times and then just tossed it in the trash and went back to Liquid Grip. It is liquid chalk though and it will add grip.....was especially handy when gripping it to throw in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: I'm addicted
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this product multiple times, and I won't go to the gym without it. My gym allows/supplies regular dry chalk, but I prefer the liquid for the base layer. It's grippy without being annoying or sticky, is an excellent base for either more liquid or dry, and lasts. Easy to reapply, the solvent doesn't stink, and blowing on my palms dries it quickly. Love this stuff, can't endorse it strongly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would order again!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this about 2 wks ago... something happened to the package... I emailed them... they responded the same night... this was a Fri night... by Monday I had a new item... I've used it during Deadlift, Rows, and Pull Ups... love it and so do my training clients.
customer_reviews.author: Beniamin Pojoga

customer_reviews.title: Good for increasing grip strength for deadlifts
customer_reviews.text: Before using chalk, my grip started to fail me at around 270ish pounds for deadlifts, and I had to use straps for anything above that weight. Using this product, I was able to ditch my straps for deadlifts completely, even at higher weights. Everyone who uses straps for deadlifts should consider using chalk to improve grip strength instead of being too reliant on straps.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I like the product. Skip the little bottle.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it'd be practical to have a little bottle for my gym bag. No joke, the chalk had hardened in the little bottle and rendered it completely useless. Just buy the big bottle and skip on the little thing. You can just squeeze the bottle onto your hand. Chalk is great. My lift bro's started using this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Sedivy

customer_reviews.title: Great for sweaty hands!
customer_reviews.text: I have sweaty hands, so excersizes like the lat pulldown and the seated row felt like the equipment was being pulled out of my slippery grip. My forearms hurt more than the target muscle group! This liquid chalk is easy to use, is way less messy than standard/powdered chalk, and washes off easily. It allows me to focus on the workout instead of my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Pestka

customer_reviews.title: Clean application
customer_reviews.text: It a clean application upon applying. Just one time and you’re done. Unlike traditional chalk when constant reapplication is needed and makes more of a mess. Washes off easily. But for the same amount of money, traditional seems to be the more economical value
customer_reviews.author: Angeleno

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver! And hand saver! I used to never be able to give my full potential at the gym (especially deadlifts) because my hands would give out. Not any more! Great portable size and a little bit goes a long way. And it's mess free! Washes off right away with soap and water. Awesome product. Super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Josmauri

customer_reviews.title: Solid product—minor annoyance
customer_reviews.text: All around good product—works well. I’m on my third bottle. The only nit picky complaint is that the foil seal is very hard to peel off and could use a tab. I’m usually at the gym when trying to open for the first time and I’ll have to use my index finger to poke a hole and then a bunch of product gets imbedded under my fingernail. Also if you can’t peel the seal completely off it can prevent product from coming out evenly. Small fix would make it a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: LSCook

customer_reviews.title: Perfect antidote for sweaty palms!
customer_reviews.text: I have been working out for a couple of years and recently have been attempting to do hangs as a precursor to pull-up/chin-ups. This liquid chalk has made a HUGE difference as I am a heavy sweater including my palms. I always knew it wasn't just my back and shoulder muscles and once I started using the chalk, it greatly improved my grip which improved my hang time (as well as my confidence!) This is the brand my gym uses and since I use it regularly, I thought it would be best to buy my own. It is exactly what I needed to further my progress!
customer_reviews.author: beanshops

customer_reviews.title: Expected product similar to liquid grip, got garbage
customer_reviews.text: 0/10 would not buy again, comes off extremely easy might as well use real chalk, which leads to 2 problems 1. Gym doesn't like it because well you got chalk everywhere 2. No product left on hands after 3 or 4 sets and hands are slick once again Worst liquid chalk I've ever used
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, thick layered liquid chalk!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! A little liquid chalk for a lot on your hand! I actually prefer this over regular chalk since I don't have to apply it as much as regular chalk. You can use a drop of liquid chalk, rub it in your hands, and air it out as you watch your whole hands covered in chalk in a thick layer.
customer_reviews.author: Marco M.

customer_reviews.title: Never used chalk. Added 70 lbs to my double over hand DL
customer_reviews.text: Never used chalk before so I thought i just had a weak deadlift. I could DL 315 double overhand for 4 or 5 lifts. One time i managed 335 for 1. WITH THE CHALK i did 315 for 7 reps and had to stop myself. I went up to 405 and beat my record by 70 lbs just using chalk. Mind blown, i thought i just had a weak grip that made the bar rollout out of my hands... Try chalk if you havent used it before.
customer_reviews.author: Daved

customer_reviews.title: Starting out on the wrong foot.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 250ml + 50ml bottles, but only recieved the 50ml bottle. My only option seems to be to return the order and buy it again hoping I get both products next time. If I have to return it I'm buying a different brand second time around.
customer_reviews.author: Tanocka

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I deadlift and recently switched gyms that has a 'no chalk' policy. After seeing some super heavy lifters using something, I asked what it was and if they'd gotten grief about it. Liquid chalk, and no problems so far. This liquid chalk works well for deadlifting. It doesn't kick up a bunch of particles into the air. It does feel weird when you wash it off, but that's something I can get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Heather M

customer_reviews.title: Better than Chalk
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for deadlifts. This provides just as good of grip as chalk, if not better, but without the mess! When I would finish a deadlift session with regular chalk, I looked like Pigpen from Charlie Brown. This chalk stays only on your hands much better.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad packaging.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. It does what it’s designed to do. I like to use this when I’m deadlifting, and it has helped my palms from blistering up. I’m giving it three stars because... the packaging. After a week of using this, the product won’t squeeze out the tube anymore, so I have to twist the cap off and shake some product onto my hands. Therefore, it can get messy & I lose a lot of product cause I can’t control how much I need. Maybe I got a defected product? Who knows... not sure if I’ll be repurchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Amie S.

customer_reviews.title: Gym climbing must-have
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for gym climbing where you want to sanitize your hands every now and then anyway. Also stays on much longer than chalk. There's a negative review that says it smells bad but it just smells like hand sanitizer which is an added bonus if you ask me. Who wants to smell like coconut oil anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Rainerrp

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: I like the grip, lash of chalk dust to breathe in. It takes a little time to dry and when I re apply it takes a bit not time to chalk up and when in the middle of a wad it disrupts the workout having to wait for it to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I recently joined a new gym which doesn't allow the use of regular powder chalk so I gave liquid chalk a try. I only use it when deadlifting heavy weights. It works great, no slippage. I would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J. Mangini

customer_reviews.title: Works better than gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I have small hands &have a problem holding weights & kettle bells esp during training sessions when hands start to sweat. Gloves didn’t help because sweaty hands slipped inside the gloves. But this stuff stayed on my hands whole 45 min work out & didn’t get any on the equipment. I thought it was wearing off but the white doesn’t stay white with the dirty metal kettle bells but kept my grip whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Justmebella

customer_reviews.title: Great for rope climbs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for rope climbs and have to say it’s the best solution I’ve tried and that includes dry chalk and receiver gloves. You’ll love this stuff
customer_reviews.author: Amazon360

customer_reviews.title: Great Chalk!!
customer_reviews.text: We recently left out crossfit gym for a cheaper alternative and of course theres no chalk now but we decided to give this a try and it's great and does the job even during high intensity workouts. Cleans up easily with wipe :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff helps!
customer_reviews.text: Helps tremendously with my workouts as my hands do sweat quite a bit. Especially makes pull ups easier as well as benching grip-wise. I did find I had to reapply a couple times but maybe next time I can go heavier on the initial application. Recommend giving this a shot!
customer_reviews.author: Verified

customer_reviews.title: Awesome liquid chalk
customer_reviews.text: Little to no mess, great for globo gyms or gyms that don't allow chalk. Dries within 30 seconds and lasts for me through some heavy deadlifts. I only have to reapply once or twice at the most.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: The chalk will not come out of the hole. ...
customer_reviews.text: The chalk will not come out of the hole. I have to unscrew it every time I want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but worth it if you can’t use chalk at your gym.
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. It dries really fast and allows you to get a great grip. It dissipates a little if you’re sweating a lot but not much . Just a dab will do ya .
customer_reviews.author: EMS Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Easy quick and useful
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My son weight trains and loves this goes on liquid instantly dries to chalk and stays put...easy to wash off...his new work out favorite plus he bought the refill bottle to simply fill the clip on he takes to gym.
customer_reviews.author: RoseMarie

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE QUALITY. BUY REAL CHALK
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed with this product. Bought this after my crossfit box reopened and could no longer have a chalk bucket (covid-19). Thought it would be great to use for workouts since it was quick drying and claimed to be long lasting. Didn’t even make it through one round of my AMRAP. Came off as soon as I touched my kettlebells and created a sticky mess after my hands got sweaty. Would recommend just sticking to regular chalk.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Goolsby

customer_reviews.title: it works great but you really have to shake it hard to ...
customer_reviews.text: To be clear, it works great but you really have to shake it hard to get it properly mixed or you end up with more glue than chalk on your hands. (It's not glue but some sticky substance that must be the base layer)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: It's very useful and clean.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this product. I bought it for deadlift and it's so much easier to carry and control the mess vs loose chalk. I also like to just apply it to the top half of my palm to save product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All the grip, no cleanup
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for working out with heavy deadlifts at Lifetime fitness where they don’t allow chalk. This provides good grip with no mess. Little bit goes a long way. Love this this
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Re buy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a few chalk brands. They all have a funky smell. This one is a little more potent but not bad. Great texture. Great coverage. Great consistency. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! The liquid dries really quickly and I can get to work. I’ve used this during really hot workouts and it works as it should. It’s washes off easily too!
customer_reviews.author: Taina

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Packaging is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Leaves a decent layer of chalk and doesn't take more than 5-10 seconds to dry. The packaging needs some work, though. The paper seal ended up getting stuck in the bottle cap and needed to be poked out with a paper clip.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Liquid chalk, it works, but it's not regular chalk
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer regular chalk to this stuff. Liquid chalk kind of makes a mess that's harder to wipe off than regular chalk. But it works fine enough for it's purpose and my new gym doesn't allow regular chalk so this is all I can use. It does it's job which is to help grab a bar and rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Max Lambert

product_meta.title: Fire Team Fit Liquid Chalk for Weight Lifting, Rock Climing, Cross Training, Powerlifting, Gym Approved Workout Chalk for Hands & Calluses
feature_bullets: 🧗🏼‍LIQUID CHALK - Portable with less mess than block chalk and much less waste. Ideal for gyms who do not allow block chalk or for a home gym where you do not want a mess.
✅EASY TO APPLY - Quick dry and sweat resistant formula. Perfect for weightlifting and obstacle courses.
☣️ANTIBACTERIAL - Hand sanitizing properties keep hands germ-free at the gym.

🏋🏽‍GET A GRIP - Significantly improves grip ability for Pull-Ups, Deadlifts, Kettlebells, Rock Climbing, Gymnastics and many other sports activities. Customers claim that they can increase Deadlifts by up to 20% with the additional grip.

🕘LONG-LASTING - This chalk can last through an entire weightlifting workout without the need to re-apply, unlike traditional block chalk. When the chalk dries, it sticks better to your hands and creates a long-lasting base layer.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
